label: lem-euclidean-perturb-moment
name: Perturbation second moment in the Sasaki metric

attributes_added.label: attr-quadratic-growth-control
attributes_added.expression: The kinetic perturbation kernel has second moment growing at most quadratically in state norm: C_x^{(\mathrm{pert})} = 3\lambda_v A_x^2, C_v^{(\mathrm{pert})} = 3\lambda_v A_v^2, C_0^{(\mathrm{pert})} = 2\tau^2 V_{\mathrm{alg}}^2 + 2\tau\sigma_x^2 d + 3\lambda_v A_0^2 + \lambda_v\sigma_v^2\tau d

attributes_added.label: attr-feller-property
attributes_added.expression: The capped kinetic kernel composes continuous affine map, 1-Lipschitz projection \psi_v, and Gaussian with full support, hence is Feller

mathematical_content.statement: The capped kinetic kernel (BAOAB velocity update with Gaussian noise followed by squashing projection and Euler position step) satisfies: (1) Quadratic second-moment bound in Sasaki metric with explicit coefficients, (2) Feller property (continuous kernel with full support).
mathematical_content.proof_strategy: Three-step explicit computation: (1) Bound positional increment using velocity cap, (2) Bound velocity increment using Lipschitz properties of force and flow fields plus squashing contraction, (3) Assemble Sasaki metric and apply Cauchy-Schwarz.
key_techniques: Lipschitz bounds for force and auxiliary flow

dependencies_on_parameters.tau: Time step size - appears in drift coefficients A_x, A_v, A_0 and directly in C_0_pert
dependencies_on_parameters.sigma_x: Positional noise scale - contributes to C_0_pert via 2τσ_x² d term
dependencies_on_parameters.sigma_v: Velocity noise scale - contributes to C_0_pert via λ_v σ_v² τ d term
dependencies_on_parameters.lambda_v: Sasaki metric velocity weight - scales all velocity contributions
dependencies_on_parameters.V_alg: Velocity cap - appears in C_0_pert via 2τ² V_alg² term
dependencies_on_parameters.gamma_fric: Friction coefficient - controls A_v and contributes to A_x, A_0
dependencies_on_parameters.m: Mass parameter - appears in force scaling in A_x and A_0
dependencies_on_parameters.d: Ambient dimension - scales Gaussian noise contributions

mathematical_content.physical_interpretation: The lemma establishes Lyapunov-style control for the kinetic perturbation: on unbounded domains, we cannot demand uniform moment bounds, but we can control growth. The quadratic dependence on ‖x‖ and ‖v‖ is sharp (cannot be improved to linear) due to Lipschitz force field. The Feller property ensures continuous dependence on initial conditions, critical for Markov chain convergence theory.
